translation.en: -[player 1] Keep the pack together! -[players yelling]
translation.fr:
un jeu amateur dominé par les aristocrates
qui en ont inventé les règles. Restez groupés.

translation.en: [player 1] Come on, Arthur!
[player 2] Drive it forwards.
[player 3] Well played, Arthur.
-[boy 1] Here he comes! -[boy 2] Are you sure it's him?
[reporter] Mr. Kinnaird, will the Old Etonians
take the FA Cup this year? [boy 1] Can we have an autograph?
What of your quarter-final opponents, Darwen FC?
translation.fr:
Et vos adversaires
de quarts de finale, Darwen FC ?

translation.en: What do you think? Can they stop me winning another Cup?
-Oh, no, no, no! Not at all, sir! -[boy 1] Never!
You can quote them on that.
Ah, it's a wonder your head still fits through the door.
translation.fr:
Étonnant que votre tête
passe encore les portes.

translation.en: [man] Fergus Suter, you and I are gonna make history.
translation.fr:
Fergus Suter, vous et moi
allons entrer dans l'histoire.

translation.en: [station attendant] Darwen. This is Darwen.
translation.fr: Vous êtes en gare de Darwen.

translation.en: -[train whistle blows] -Come on. Let's go.
[man] I've seen how you play in Scotland.
translation.fr: Je vous ai vu jouer en Écosse.

translation.en: Your passing game is the future of football.
translation.fr:
Votre jeu de passe
est l'avenir du football.

translation.en: [man] Let's talk in my office.
So...
-How you both feeling? -Ready to get started.
So long as you keep your end of the bargain.
translation.fr:
Tant que vous honorez
vos engagements.

translation.en: Food and board's all arranged, as agreed.
translation.fr: Le gîte et le couvert sont fournis.

translation.en: They're not gonna know what's hit 'em.
translation.fr: Ils ne le verront pas venir.

translation.en: Who are the new lads, then?
No idea.
[man 1] Not from round here, that's for sure.
They're not mill workers either.
[man 2] Why has Walsh gone and brought them here?
translation.fr: Pourquoi Walsh les a fait venir, alors ?

translation.en: [man 3] Got our new jerseys, lads.
Finished 'em up last night.
translation.fr: Je les ai finis hier soir.

translation.en: [man 3] And youse, captain.
-There you go. -[man 4] Ready for the big game Saturday?
And one for each of the new lads.
That's all there was, Mr. Walsh. I've only done 11.
translation.fr:
Il n'y en a plus, M. Walsh.
Je n'en ai fait que 11.

translation.en: Jones, Harris, you don't mind, do you?
translation.fr: Jones, Harris, cela ne vous dérange pas ?

translation.en: I'd like to give Mr. Suter and Mr. Love a chance.
translation.fr:
J'aimerais donner
une chance à M. Suter et M. Love.

translation.en: Fergus Suter...
and Jimmy Love?
Not the Fergus Suter and Jimmy Love who play for Partick?
translation.fr:
Les Fergus Suter et Jimmy Love
qui jouent pour Partick ?

translation.en: They don't play for Partick anymore. They're Darwen players now.
translation.fr:
Ils ne jouent plus pour Partick
mais pour Darwen.

translation.en: Mr. Walsh,
with respect, sir, Jones and Harris helped us get to the quarter-finals.
translation.fr:
sauf votre respect, grâce à Jones
et Harris, on est quarts de finale.

translation.en: And these two are going to help us win the damn thing. Now, this is my mill.
translation.fr:
Et ils nous aideront à gagner la Coupe.
C'est mon usine.

translation.en: My team.
[Walsh] Now, give 'em the jerseys.
[Walsh] Good lads.
I've put you in here.
This is nice.
[woman] Mr. Walsh was most particular.
translation.fr: M. Walsh a été très exigeant.

translation.en: Which of you is Mr. Suter?
translation.fr: Lequel d'entre vous est M. Suter ?

translation.en: That's me.
That means you must be Mr. Love.
translation.fr: Et vous devez être M. Love.

translation.en: Guilty as charged.
Does Mr. Platt work for Mr. Walsh?
translation.fr: M. Platt travaille pour M. Walsh ?

translation.en: Uh, he used to. I'm a widow.
Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.
-Jimmy, for the love of God, no. -What?
[Fergus] Keep your mind on the game.
Did you know there were 43 teams in the Cup this year?
translation.fr:
Saviez-vous qu'il y a 43 équipes
dans la Coupe cette année ?

translation.en: And Arthur's is one of the last eight left in.
translation.fr:
Et Arthur fait partie
d'une des huit restantes.

translation.en: Isn't that splendid?
We're playing a mill team in the quarter-finals this Saturday, Papa.
translation.fr:
Nous jouerons contre des ouvriers
en quarts de finale, papa.

translation.en: Really?
The quarter-finals?
Do the millhands often get that far?
translation.fr: Les équipes ouvrières ne vont pas si loin.

translation.en: [Arthur] No, not usually.
[Lord Kinnaird] Will you go on with this once your child arrives?
translation.fr:
Continuerez-vous
une fois votre enfant né ?

translation.en: I hadn't given it much thought.
Did you play much sport, Papa?
I shot, of course.
I never hunted.
-I'm not against it-- -But you are against football?
translation.fr:
- Je ne suis pas contre.
- Vous êtes contre le football.

translation.en: No, no, no, no, no.
I think it a healthy way for little boys to get fit.
translation.fr:
C'est un moyen sain pour les garçons
de garder la forme.

translation.en: [station attendant] All aboard!
All passengers!
Train's about to depart!
translation.fr:
JOUR DES QUARTS DE FINALE
DE LA COUPE D'ANGLETERRE

translation.en: All aboard, please!
[Walsh] Only gentlemen have lifted the Cup.
translation.fr: Seuls des gentlemen ont remporté la Coupe.

translation.en: Men from fine schools,
with fine clothes, fine lives.
translation.fr: avec de beaux habits, de belles vies.

translation.en: Imagine what it would mean to see men like us lift it.
translation.fr:
Imaginez si des hommes
comme nous la remportaient.

translation.en: That's the dream.
[Walsh] Well, I want to wake up and find it's more than a dream.
translation.fr: Je veux que cela soit plus qu'un rêve.

translation.en: To find out it's happened.
See, that's the reason I brought you to Darwen, Fergus.
translation.fr:
Vous avez rejoint Darwen pour cela,
Fergus.

translation.en: [Walsh] Wait here, lads.
[Darwen player] Stop, lads. Hold up.
What do you make of this, lads?
You'd think the Queen lived here.
Boys.
-[Darwen player] Look at these lads! -Gentlemen.
[Arthur] Welcome.
I'm, uh... I'm captain of the Old Etonians.
translation.fr: Je suis le capitaine des Old Etonians.

translation.en: -You're Arthur Kinnaird? -That's right.
I saw you play at Hampden a few years back against Queen's Park.
translation.fr:
Je vous ai vu jouer à Hampden
contre Queen's Park.

translation.en: [stammers] You were good.
Well, that's high praise indeed.
Of course, the game's changed since your heyday.
I mean, it has in Scotland, at least.
Must be hard moving with the times.
translation.fr: Pas évident de vivre avec son temps.

translation.en: Well, now we've established that my best days are in the past,
translation.fr:
Maintenant qu'il est établi
que ma gloire est révolue,

translation.en: perhaps we should get moving.
-I never meant-- -What's your name?
translation.fr:
- allons-y.
- Je ne voulais pas... Votre nom ?

translation.en: Fergus Suter.
The Suter who plays for Hibernian?
translation.fr: Le Suter qui joue pour Hibernian ?

translation.en: Partick.
Well, I used to, at any rate.
Now I play for Darwen.
It's hardly a... hardly a local team for you.
translation.fr: Ce n'est pas une équipe locale pour vous.

translation.en: Jimmy and I wanted a change of scene.
translation.fr: Jimmy et moi voulions du changement.

translation.en: -Jimmy? -Jimmy Love.
-He made the trip down, too. -Did he indeed?
translation.fr:
- Il a fait le voyage également.
- Ça alors.

translation.en: Uh, everyone, these boys will show you to your changing rooms.
translation.fr:
Les garçons
vous montreront vos vestiaires.

translation.en: [Darwen player] Hurry up, lads. Suit up and boot up.
I've been through our Football Association records,
translation.fr:
J'ai parcouru les dossiers
de la fédération.

translation.en: and neither Fergus Suter nor Jimmy Love played for them in the previous rounds.
translation.fr:
Ni Suter ni Love n'ont participé
lors des tours précédents.

translation.en: There's nothing in the rules that say they can't switch team members.
translation.fr: Rien ne les empêche de changer de joueurs.

translation.en: True, but why would two successful Scottish players
translation.fr:
Mais pourquoi
deux joueurs écossais à succès

translation.en: leave Glasgow to join a tinpot mill team in Darwen?
translation.fr:
ont-ils quitté Glasgow
pour une équipe de pacotille ?

translation.en: Clearly, they're being paid.
To play football? But that's against the rules.
translation.fr: Pour jouer au football ? C'est contre les règles.

translation.en: Surely, no one would risk suspension from the Cup?
translation.fr:
Personne ne risquerait
d'être suspendu de la Coupe.

translation.en: It would explain why two players would travel from Scotland to join a team they have no connection with.
translation.fr:
Donc deux écossais rejoignent une équipe
avec laquelle ils n'ont aucun lien.

translation.en: -Now, how do we prove it? -[Arthur] We don't need to.
We'll beat them today,
and they'll be knocked out the competition.
-Are we right, lads? -[players] Aye.
[Walsh] Now, remember, they're a rough team.
They'll play as a pack and try to run through you.
translation.fr: Ils joueront groupé pour vous faire mal.

translation.en: -[player 1] Let's go then, boys. -[player 2] Come on. Stick together.
translation.fr:
- Allons-y.
- On se serre les coudes.

translation.en: When we get out, I lead from the front.
-Come on. -[Jimmy] Fergie!
You coming?
[woman] What's all this to-do about?
Playing in the quarter-finals of the FA Cup. -Really? -Yeah.
translation.fr:
- On est en quarts de finale de la Coupe.
- Vraiment ?

translation.en: Just waiting on news from the match.
translation.fr: Oui. On attend des nouvelles du match.

translation.en: Well, I've made it, Mr. Suter,
translation.fr: Je suis toujours là, M. Suter,

translation.en: even if my glory days are behind me.
translation.fr: même si ma gloire est révolue.

translation.en: Right. Let's knock these posh bastards off the perch.
translation.fr: Faisons tomber ces snobs de leur perchoir.

translation.en: Right. Go on, lads. Let's go.
Is that it?
I suppose he's the captain, Fergus.
Stay tight.
Yep.
[Etonian player] Come on, boys. Send them back.
[Fergus] Play the ball.
[Darwen player] Come on! In tight!
-[Arthur] Take him! -[Fergus grunts]
[Darwen player] Come on now!
Game doesn't seem to have changed so very much, Mr. Suter.
translation.fr: Le jeu n'a pas tant changé, M. Suter.

translation.en: [Darwen player] Come on. Come on, boys.
[man] The Old Etonians have scored again!
translation.fr: Les Old Etonians ont encore marqué !

translation.en: -[Darwen player] There we go! -Yes!
-We got one back! -[crowd cheers]
-It's three-one! -Yes!
-[whistle blows] -[referee] Half-time!
[referee] Half-time, gentlemen.
That Kinnaird is a bloody hard man to get around.
translation.fr: Kinnaird est un dur à cuire.

translation.en: We need to fight fire with fire.
They shove you, you shove 'em back. They hit you, you hit 'em back.
translation.fr:
S'ils vous poussent, poussez-les.
S'ils vous frappent, frappez-les.

translation.en: -You can't win playing at their own game. -So, what do you suggest we do instead?
translation.fr:
- On ne les battra pas à leur propre jeu.
- Que proposes-tu ?

translation.en: [Etonian] At this rate, I'm gonna be coming out.
translation.fr: À ce rythme, je vais sortir.

translation.en: I want five more goals this half,
translation.fr:
Je veux cinq buts
en deuxième mi-temps.

translation.en: so we have something to celebrate at dinner.
translation.fr: Pour avoir quelque chose à célébrer.

translation.en: [all] Yes!
What makes you such an expert?
I'm telling you how we play in Scotland, that's all.
translation.fr: On jouait comme ça en Écosse.

translation.en: Would you listen to him?
But Marshall's the captain.
Well, Suter's the captain now.
Lads, football is not complicated.
translation.fr: Les gars, le football n'est pas compliqué.

translation.en: We don't always have to run the ball forward.
translation.fr: On n'a pas à avancer avec le ballon.

translation.en: I'll stay behind, and I'll play it back.
translation.fr: Je resterai derrière et ferai des passes.

translation.en: Jimmy, you know what you're doing, right?
translation.fr: Jimmy, tu sais ce que tu as à faire ?

translation.en: Tommy, this game is about space.
translation.fr:
Tommy, dans ce jeu,
il faut utiliser l'espace.

translation.en: I want you to go out wide on the left.
translation.fr: Tu iras vers le flanc gauche.

translation.en: You're the fastest man on the pitch. You're not getting a chance to show it.
translation.fr:
Tu es le plus rapide. Tu n'as pas eu l'occasion de le montrer.
Laissez faire la balle.

translation.en: [Fergus] Let the ball do the work.
translation.fr:
Tu n'as pas eu l'occasion de le montrer.
Laissez faire la balle.

translation.en: We pass, we move, we pass again.
translation.fr: On passe, on bouge, une autre passe.

translation.en: Space.
But that's not how we play.
translation.fr: On ne joue pas comme ça.

translation.en: Wider. Right out onto the touchline.
translation.fr: Plus large. Près de la touche.

translation.en: Spread out.
-They've moved their formation. -Isn't that better?
translation.fr:
- Ils ont changé leur formation.
- N'est-ce pas mieux ?

translation.en: We'll run right through them.
-Come on, boys! I want the same again. -[whistle blows]
translation.fr: Allez, les gars ! Je veux la même chose.

translation.en: -[Arthur] Same again! -Here we go, Darwen.
Yes!
[player] Get it over to him! Yeah!
It's five-four!
The ball's gone before you can put a tackle in.
translation.fr:
On perd la balle
avant de pouvoir attaquer.

translation.en: Just do whatever it takes.
Come on! Come on!
[woman] It's five-five!
[referee] It's full-time, gentlemen.
-[thunder rumbling] -[referee] Full-time, thank you.
We'll take a few minutes to get fresh air into our lungs and then extra time.
translation.fr:
On va respirer cinq minutes
et on jouera les prolongations.

translation.en: Look, no extra time was agreed before the game.
Since when was that a rule?
It's not in Scotland.
translation.fr: Cela ne l'est pas en Écosse.

translation.en: It is here.
Come on, boys.
[Etonian player] I'm glad that's finished. That was more tiring than I expected.
translation.fr: Content d'en avoir fini. C'était plus fatigant que je ne pensais.

translation.en: He said no to extra time.
What's all this about? Why are we not playing extra time?
translation.fr:
Pourquoi on ne joue pas
les prolongations ?

translation.en: [Fergus] Because he knows they're beaten.
It'll be replayed next Saturday.
These men have been up since before dawn and traveled for hours.
translation.fr:
Ils se sont levés tôt
et ont voyagé de loin.

translation.en: You expect them to do it all again?
translation.fr: Vous vous imaginez qu'ils le referont ?

translation.en: We're here now. Let's finish it now.
Look, we can refer this to the president of the Football Association,
translation.fr:
Nous pouvons en parler au président
de la fédération,

translation.en: if you prefer.
-Well, how long will that take? -Not too long.
translation.fr:
- Ça prendra du temps ?
- Pas longtemps.

translation.en: Marindin?
He's the president of the FA? He's your bloody goalkeeper.
translation.fr:
C'est lui, le président ?
C'est votre gardien de but.

translation.en: We're all on the board of the Football Association. Do you have a problem with that?
translation.fr:
Nous siégeons tous au conseil.
Cela vous pose problème ?

translation.en: Don't you?
I'm afraid extra time wasn't agreed, gentlemen.
Those are the rules.
And rules are made to be adhered to. [Fergus] We had you beaten today.
translation.fr:
- Les règles doivent être respectées.
- On vous a battus.

translation.en: You know we did.
If you are right,
then you'll beat us again...
next Saturday.
No, I just worry one day Arthur will come home with a broken leg.
translation.fr:
J'ai peur qu'Arthur
rentre avec une jambe cassée.

translation.en: Well, if he does, you can be sure it won't be his own.
translation.fr: Ce ne sera pas la sienne.

translation.en: -[Alma laughs] -What am I missing up there?
Oh, Monkey's telling me about the game.
Ah, Arthur's returning the favor at this end of the table.
Have you told her how it ended?
[sighs] There's nothing to tell.
translation.fr: Il n'y a rien à dire.

translation.en: Well, now I'm intrigued.
[chuckles] Uh, it's not really my story.
How strange. Usually, I can't stop you talking about football.
translation.fr:
Curieux. Vous n'arrêtez pas
de parler de football.

translation.en: Or cricket.
Or rugby, for that matter.
When it was a draw, Arthur wouldn't allow them extra time to settle it.
translation.fr:
Après un match nul, Arthur n'a pas voulu
jouer les prolongations.

translation.en: So they must come back next week. All the way from Lancashire?
translation.fr:
- Ils devront revenir samedi prochain.
- Depuis le Lancashire ?

translation.en: In all the years we've been married, I believe this is the first time you've ever asked me a single question about football.
translation.fr:
C'est bien la première fois
que vous me parlez de football.

translation.en: But is it true, Arthur?
We had to do what was right.
It seems rather unkind.
-Can I second that? -[Marindin] We must follow the rules.
translation.fr:
- Je suis d'accord.
- Il faut respecter les règles.

translation.en: -Or why do we have them? -Absolutely.
And if you'd agreed extra time, Darwen would've beaten you.
translation.fr:
Si vous aviez prolongé,
Darwen vous aurait battus.

translation.en: [chuckles] Don't be absurd.
Sorry, old boy, but I must agree.
translation.fr: Désolé, mon vieux, mais je suis d'accord.

translation.en: Another ten minutes and you would've been out of the Cup on your ear.
translation.fr:
Dix minutes de plus
et vous auriez été éliminés.

translation.en: Are you suggesting I acted in an underhand manner?
translation.fr:
Insinuez-vous
que j'ai agi de manière sournoise ?

translation.en: Well, I think "underhand" is a bit strong.
Shall we say, uh, the rules were very convenient.
translation.fr:
Disons que les règles
se sont avérées utiles.

translation.en: Do you really think we would've been beaten by a gaggle of--
translation.fr:
Pensez-vous vraiment
que nous aurions été battus par des...

translation.en: Of what? Mill workers?
No. Professionals.
Darwen team are fielding professional players.
Paying two members of their team to play.
translation.fr: Ils payent deux membres de leur équipe.

translation.en: But what's wrong with that?
This is a game for amateurs and gentlemen.
translation.fr:
C'est un sport pour amateurs
et gentlemen.

translation.en: It's our game. [laughs] Your game?
-We invented it. -[Alma] Who's "we"?
The Old Etonians?
[Arthur] Yes! As a matter of fact.
Eton, Charterhouse, Harrow. Lots of schools played a part,
translation.fr:
Eton, Charterhouse, Harrow,
beaucoup d'écoles ont joué leur rôle.

translation.en: but the point is we took a raggle-taggle pastime...
translation.fr: Mais nous avons fait d'un passe-temps

translation.en: with different rules wherever it was played, and we turned it into a proper game.
translation.fr:
aux règles différentes à chaque match,
un sport respectable.

translation.en: For gentlemen.
Heavens. Do gentlemen shout?
Ladies...
I'm catching your eye.
Shall we leave the men to their port?
translation.fr: Laissons les hommes à leur port.

translation.en: Well, shall we talk about something a little less contentious?
translation.fr:
Parlons de quelque chose
d'un peu moins litigieux.

translation.en: What? Like the Russian-Turkish War?
I feel like a fraud.
We're celebrating like we won.
translation.fr: On fête comme si on avait gagné.

translation.en: We didn't win, did we?
We came nearer to winning than we ever have done before.
translation.fr:
Nous étions plus près de gagner
que jamais.

translation.en: And we may yet do it Saturday.
Look around.
You've given these people something to believe in.
translation.fr:
Vous leur avez donné
une raison d'y croire.

translation.en: The game feeds the soul
when they have nothing else that does it in their life.
translation.fr: ils n'ont rien d'autre dans leur vie.

translation.en: I'm gonna head back.
-Come on, it's just getting started. -Jimmy, here.
translation.fr:
- La soirée ne fait que commencer.
- Tiens.

translation.en: Don't drink too much.
Fergie, come on, pal. Look, what's one more beer?
translation.fr:
Fergie, mon vieux.
Juste une autre bière.

translation.en: Come on.
Well, I suppose I am allowed an opinion.
translation.fr: J'ai le droit d'avoir un avis.

translation.en: Not on things you don't understand.
translation.fr: Pas sur ce qui vous échappe.

translation.en: I think I understand perfectly.
You're afraid of them, aren't you?
Afraid?
You're afraid new teams like Darwen will take over your game.
translation.fr:
Que des équipes comme Darwen
s'emparent de votre sport.

translation.en: You and Alfred and all the others.
You're scared you'll lose control of it.
translation.fr: Vous avez peur d'en perdre le contrôle.

translation.en: That's ridiculous.
Is it?
Arthur, you're a decent man, but this game brings out the worst in you.
translation.fr:
Vous êtes un homme bien,
mais ce jeu révèle votre part d'ombre.

translation.en: Makes you childish and defensive and petulant.
translation.fr:
Il vous rend puéril,
défensif et irritable.

translation.en: Well, I'm sorry if I disappoint you.
What?
I want us to be good parents...
translation.fr: Je veux que nous soyons de bons parents

translation.en: and to set a good example for our child.
translation.fr: et donner le bon exemple à notre enfant.

translation.en: We will be.
Of course we will be. Why wouldn't we be?
I'm Fergus... Suter.
Oh, I know who you are.
People won't stop shouting your name.
I'm Martha Almond.
You should've sung in the pub tonight.
translation.fr: Vous auriez dû chanter au pub.

translation.en: I should get going.
I could...
I could walk you home, if you like.
See, it's like this.
I have a little girl. She's two years old.
translation.fr: J'ai une fille. Elle a deux ans.

translation.en: She has no dad.
He's gone, but... I was never married to him in the first place.
translation.fr:
Il est parti,
mais nous n'étions pas mariés.

translation.en: Do you still want to walk me home?
Sure.
Why not?
We got off on the wrong foot. Let me buy you another.
translation.fr:
On est partis sur de mauvaises bases
Je t'en achète une autre.

translation.en: I shouldn't.
But go on, then.
I'm buying, though. No arguments.
translation.fr: Mais je te la paie. Pas de discussion.

translation.en: So what did Walsh offer to get you all the way down from Glasgow?
translation.fr:
Qu'est-ce que Walsh vous a offert
pour vous faire quitter Glasgow ?

translation.en: [man] Oh, my head!
Feels good to have a man in the house again.
translation.fr:
Contente d'avoir à nouveau
un homme à la maison.

translation.en: I hope you don't mind me saying, but...
translation.fr: Sans vouloir vous rendre mal à l'aise...

translation.en: you've got a lovely smile.
-Sorry, I don't mean to embarrass you. -No, you didn't.
translation.fr:
- Je ne voulais pas vous embarrasser.
- Non.

translation.en: What's coming next, I wonder?
How about this?
We best get going.
Aye, we should.
-Thanks for that. -Ah, pleasure.
Oh, won't you have some breakfast?
Oh, just a piece of bread.
Gentlemen,
the situation is no longer tenable.
Our mills are struggling to turn a profit,
translation.fr:
Nos usines ont du mal
à réaliser des profits,

translation.en: and the banks are starting to call in their loans.
translation.fr: et les banques exigent d'être remboursées.

translation.en: It is regrettable that the only course of action
translation.fr:
C'est regrettable,
mais la seule chose à faire

translation.en: I can see to protect our business is a wage cut.
translation.fr:
pour protéger notre affaire
est une baisse des salaires.

translation.en: As chairman of the guild, I must insist that we present a united front on this matter.
translation.fr:
En tant que président du syndicat,
nous devons présenter un front uni.

translation.en: To do otherwise would only invite trouble.
I propose a five-percent wage cut for every worker.
translation.fr:
Je propose une baisse de salaire
de cinq pour cent par ouvrier.

translation.en: -All those in favor. -[all] Aye!
All those against?
Nay.
Most of my workers have families.
They can barely get by as it is.
James, you know I don't like it,
but the alternative is that the mills go out of business.
translation.fr: mais les usines pourraient faire faillite.

translation.en: [man] How will they get by then?
How many workers do you employ at your mill, Mr. Walsh?
translation.fr:
Combien avez-vous d'employés
dans votre usine, M. Walsh ?

translation.en: A couple of hundred?
A hundred and seventy-seven.
Across my mills, I have 3,000.
translation.fr: Dans toutes mes usines, j'en ai 3 000.

translation.en: Cartwright?
Two thousand.
Two-and-a-half.
[chairman] The motion is passed.
Every member of the Cotton Masters' Guild
translation.fr:
Chaque membre du syndicat
des Maîtres du coton,

translation.en: will impose the same cut in wages.
translation.fr: imposera la même baisse de salaire.

translation.en: Do you ever worry...
about whether you'd make a good father?
translation.fr: si vous feriez un bon père ?

translation.en: Not really.
I suppose I assumed...
that it would be just as it had been for my father.
translation.fr: que cela serait comme pour mon père.

translation.en: And for his father before him.
I don't remember seeing much of you when I was young.
translation.fr: Je vous voyais peu, étant jeune.

translation.en: Don't be silly.
You were brought down every evening.
No.
I was brought down every tea time.
translation.fr: Je descendais à l'heure du thé.

translation.en: Or after tea, if Mama had guests, but I don't remember your being there often.
translation.fr:
Après le thé, si maman avait des invités.
Vous étiez rarement là.

translation.en: I was here.
You came and saw me sometimes when I was already in bed.
translation.fr:
Vous veniez parfois me voir
une fois couché.

translation.en: But not much.
All over this country...
all over the world,
there are children with no food and no shelter.
translation.fr:
il y a des enfants
sans nourriture et sans abri.

translation.en: You really cannot expect me to feel much sympathy
translation.fr: Ne vous attendez pas à ce que je m'apitoie

translation.en: for the childhood that you enjoyed.
translation.fr: sur l'enfance que vous avez eue.

translation.en: So, there's nothing you would have done differently?
Don't over-complicate it.
Your role is to provide.
translation.fr: Votre rôle est de subvenir aux besoins.

translation.en: To be the man of the house.
[Alma] Don't tell me you've quarreled again.
translation.fr:
Ne me dites pas
que vous vous êtes encore fâchés.

translation.en: We were discussing fatherhood...
as it happens.
Oh, you surprise me. [chuckles]
You wouldn't be surprised if you heard what he said.
translation.fr: Ce qu'il a dit ne vous surprendrait pas.

translation.en: And you'll be happy to hear that I want to know my children better than he did.
translation.fr:
Vous serez ravie d'apprendre que je veux
connaître mes enfants mieux que lui.

translation.en: I am happy.
[Alma] I'm so looking forward to becoming a mother.
-They've cut wages by five percent. -[woman 1] What?
translation.fr:
- Une baisse de cinq pour cent.
- Quoi ?

translation.en: -And what's next, ten? Fifteen? -[woman 1] How will I feed my family?
translation.fr: Et après, dix ? Quinze ? Comment vais-je nourrir ma famille ?

translation.en: -I know. -[woman 2] What?
-It's a wage cut, five percent. -[woman] They can't do that.
translation.fr:
- Une baisse de cinq pour cent.
- Ils ne peuvent pas faire ça.

translation.en: -The mill will reopen tomorrow. -[crowd clamors]
Go and spend the day with your families.
-What? Why? -[worker] You've already cut our wages.
translation.fr:
Quoi ? Pourquoi ? - Vous avez déjà baissé nos salaires.
- Peu importe la raison. Je m'en occupe.

translation.en: [Walsh] It don't matter why. I'll get it sorted.
translation.fr:
- Vous avez déjà baissé nos salaires.
- Peu importe la raison. Je m'en occupe.

translation.en: What about pay? We gonna get paid for today?
translation.fr:
Et la paie ?
On sera payés pour aujourd'hui ?

translation.en: I can't pay you for days when the mill isn't working.
-[clamoring] -[Walsh] I'm sorry.
It'll all get straightened out by tomorrow.
Please, go home.
All members of Darwen Football Club, follow me.
The bank called in a loan.
translation.fr: La banque a demandé un remboursement.

translation.en: When I couldn't pay up immediately, they foreclosed on the mill.
translation.fr:
Je n'ai pas pu tout payer
et ils ont saisi l'usine.

translation.en: Now, I can get the mill reopened tomorrow, but it'll take all the liquidity.
translation.fr:
Je rouvrirai demain,
mais il me faudra toutes les liquidités.

translation.en: What's this got to do with us?
The train tickets to take the team back down to London, I need that money.
translation.fr:
Les billets de train pour ramener l'équipe
à Londres. J'ai besoin de l'argent.

translation.en: I need it to get the mill reopened and get the men back to work.
translation.fr:
J'en ai besoin pour rouvrir l'usine
et remettre les hommes au travail.

translation.en: We're gonna have to forfeit the match.
How much did you waste getting this pair in?
[man] What? [Tommy] He's paying 'em to play.
translation.fr:
- Quoi ?
- Il les paie pour jouer.

translation.en: -He paid 'em to leave Partick. -Wait a minute.
translation.fr:
Il les a payés. - Arrêtez.
- Vous avez donné de l'argent à Jimmy.

translation.en: -I saw the money you gave Jimmy. -[Walsh] That's none of your business.
translation.fr:
- Arrêtez.
- Vous avez donné de l'argent à Jimmy. - Cela ne vous regarde pas.
- Et pas de Coupe sans tickets de train.

translation.en: Now we're out of the Cup 'cause you've given away our fares.
translation.fr:
- Cela ne vous regarde pas.
- Et pas de Coupe sans tickets de train.

translation.en: You can have it back.
-Barely a quarter of what's needed. -Maybe not.
translation.fr:
- C'est le quart de ce qu'il faut.
- Peut-être pas.

translation.en: But whilst our wages were being cut, you were paying them to play football.
translation.fr:
On baisse nos salaires
mais vous les payez pour jouer.

translation.en: And what would've happened if we were found out?
We'd be banned from the Cup for God knows how many years!
translation.fr:
- On serait exclus de la Coupe !
- Assez !

translation.en: -[Walsh] Enough. -You cheated.
translation.fr:
- On serait exclus de la Coupe !
- Assez ! Vous avez triché.

translation.en: And you made the rest of us cheat without even knowing it.
translation.fr: Et vous avez fait de nous des tricheurs.

translation.en: I said that's enough!
So it's over?
I'm very sorry.
Come on.
We don't know that Mr. Walsh won't find the money somewhere.
We've given him all day.
translation.fr: Il a eu toute la journée.

translation.en: As it is, we'll be sleeping on the train.
But I-- I thought the OEs would beat us,
translation.fr:
- Mais...
- Je pensais qu'Eton nous battrait,

translation.en: and we would be sent home then, all right?
With our tail between our legs.
Don't pretend that you don't care about this place.
translation.fr:
Ne fais pas semblant
de te ficher de cet endroit.

translation.en: I seen it last night when you realized how much this meant to these people.
translation.fr:
Je l'ai vu hier soir quand tu as compris
à quel point ça comptait pour eux.

translation.en: You care about them too.
No.
I care about the money.
But we can't give up now! It's the FA Cup!
translation.fr:
- On ne peut pas abandonner la Coupe !
- C'est fini.

translation.en: It is finished, Jimmy.
translation.fr:
- On ne peut pas abandonner la Coupe !
- C'est fini. Jimmy.

translation.en: The mill's closed. We're not going south.
translation.fr:
L'usine est fermée.
On n'ira pas à Londres.

translation.en: And I can play football for nothing back home with my family.
translation.fr:
Je jouerai au football chez nous
avec ma famille.

translation.en: Pack your things.
Stay.
I can't.
But you can.
I can't.
Fergie and I...
We've always been together.
He needs me. Stay till tomorrow at least.
translation.fr:
- Il a besoin de moi.
- Reste jusqu'à demain.

translation.en: You don't want to travel at night.
translation.fr: Il ne faut pas voyager de nuit.

translation.en: Are you coming or not? Give me a minute.
translation.fr:
- Tu viens ou non ?
- Une minute.

translation.en: I swear to God.
You need rid of that hat before we get back.
translation.fr:
Débarrasse-toi
de cette casquette avant d'arriver.

translation.en: Folk'll have you down as a bloody Sassenach.
translation.fr: Les gens te prendront pour un rosbif.

translation.en: I don't care what they have me down as.
translation.fr: Je me fiche de ce qu'ils pensent.

translation.en: Jimmy!
-[panting] You've got to come quickly. -What is it?
You'll see. Come on.
Come with me, both of you.
This is our train.
We're going home.
[Fergus] I don't understand. [Doris] Word got out Darwen would be forfeiting.
translation.fr:
- Je ne comprends pas.
- Ils ont appris que Darwen abandonnait.

translation.en: The town won't have it. Tom Hindle came up with the idea.
translation.fr:
La ville ne l'accepte pas.
Tom Hindle a eu l'idée.

translation.en: We're selling subscriptions.
They can either pay weekly or all at once.
translation.fr:
Ils peuvent payer à la semaine
ou en une fois.

translation.en: The point is, we're going to the rematch.
translation.fr: En tous cas, on ira à la revanche.

translation.en: -Don't those people need that money? -Maybe, but they need football too.
translation.fr:
- Ils ont besoin de cet argent.
- Peut-être. Mais du football aussi.

translation.en: -[woman] We're proud of you, lads. -[man] You're what Darwen's made of.
translation.fr:
- On est fiers de vous.
- Darwen n'est rien sans vous.

translation.en: [woman] Here you go.
You're short three players. The match is due to start in ten minutes.
translation.fr:
Il vous manque trois joueurs.
Ça commence dans dix minutes.

translation.en: Well, I'm sure they won't be much longer.
You can use the dressing room if you'd like to be more comfortable.
translation.fr: Allez aux vestiaires, si vous préférez.

translation.en: We'll be on the pitch.
If you don't have a team on time, you forfeit.
translation.fr:
Si votre équipe est en retard,
vous perdez.

translation.en: [Walsh] Or you play with what you've got.
translation.fr: Ou jouez avec ceux que vous avez.

translation.en: You can't expect us to play when there's only eight of us.
translation.fr: Nous ne pouvons pas jouer à huit.

translation.en: To quote you, Mr. Kinnaird,
"Rules are made to be adhered to."
translation.fr:
"Les règles sont faites
pour être respectées."

translation.en: That is unless they happen not to suit you, of course.
translation.fr:
Sauf si elles ne vous
conviennent pas, bien sûr.

translation.en: Ten minutes...
or we claim the win.
To whom will you claim the win?
To the FA committee?
The press.
Then everyone will see what good sports you gentlemen are.
translation.fr:
Ainsi, tout le monde verra
que vous êtes bons joueurs.

translation.en: [scoffs] Who does he think he is?
If we don't have a full team, we ought to forfeit the game.
translation.fr:
Sans l'équipe complète,
nous devrons renoncer.

translation.en: What?
Why?
You heard him.
We're supposed to be gentlemen.
Two more minutes and the match is ours.
translation.fr: Deux minutes et la victoire est à nous.

translation.en: They're here. All of them.
Whatever he's paying you, make sure you earn it.
We had them beat before.
We can do it again.
Where the hell have you been? You almost cost us the match.
translation.fr:
Vous voilà.
Vous avez failli nous coûter le match.

translation.en: Now, come here.
Now, we'll win this game, if we stop them playing their way.
translation.fr:
Pour gagner, nous devons les empêcher
de jouer leur jeu.

translation.en: Alfred, stay on Love. Don't give him any time on the ball.
translation.fr:
Alfred, restez sur Love.
Privez-le du ballon.

translation.en: -What about Suter? He's the real problem. -[Arthur] I'll stay on Suter.
translation.fr:
- Et Suter ? C'est lui le problème.
- Je resterai sur Suter.

translation.en: You leave him to me.
-All right? -[Lyttelton] All right.
-[referee] Time. -[Lyttelton] All right, gents.
[referee] Gentlemen.
[Fergus] Jimmy!
[Fergus] Cross it, Jimmy!
[Alma] Did you see what Alfred did?
translation.fr: Avez-vous vu ce qu'il a fait ?

translation.en: It didn't seem quite right.
Maybe not, but I'm afraid there'll be a great deal more of it.
translation.fr:
Pourtant, je crains
que cela ne se reproduise.

translation.en: [Walsh] Foul! Referee!
-Forward! -[Arthur] As a pack!
-Get off me! -[grunts]
[Walsh] Come on, Suter!
[Fergus] Together! Together!
I thought you youngsters were meant to be quicker than us older folk.
translation.fr:
Je pensais que les jeunes
étaient plus rapides.

translation.en: Hurry up! At the ball! Heads up! Heads up!
[referee] Full-time. Full-time.
That was a good game.
Did you even play?
Or did you just shadow me to stop me playing?
translation.fr:
Ou m'avez-vous suivi
pour m'empêcher de jouer ?

translation.en: There's no need to be a bad loser.
Kinnaird can have his Cup.
Next season, it'll be ours.
translation.fr: La saison prochaine, elle sera à nous.

translation.en: If you'll stay.
Do you want me to?
Tommy Marshall thinks I'm a waste of money.
translation.fr:
Marshall pense
que je suis de l'argent gaspillé.

translation.en: Well, he's wrong.
You're the only chance we've got of taking the Cup.
translation.fr:
Vous êtes notre seule chance
de remporter la Coupe.

translation.en: Besides, people here, they love to watch you play.
translation.fr:
Et puis, les gens d'ici
aiment vous voir jouer.

translation.en: It gives 'em hope
and pride and so much more.
translation.fr: de la fierté et bien plus encore.

translation.en: You're valued here, Suter.
Come on, lads.
Let's go home.
Admit it, they won!
translation.fr: Ils ont réussi. Ils ont gagné.

translation.en: Can I just say, well done us.
translation.fr: Je tiens à le dire. Félicitations à nous.

translation.en: Hear, hear!
Speech!
-Come on, Arthur, speech! -[man] Speech!
Come on.
I won't pretend I'm not jolly pleased the way things have turned out.
translation.fr:
Je ne ferai pas semblant
de ne pas me réjouir du résultat.

translation.en: [Arthur] To have beaten Darwen,
and to be once again in the semi-finals...
translation.fr: et sommes à nouveau en demi-finale.

translation.en: Excuse me.
I'm so sorry, I... I must leave you for a moment.
translation.fr:
Je suis désolée.
Je dois vous quitter un instant.

translation.en: -Shall I-- -[Alma] No, no, no. Please, sit.
Enjoy the rest of dinner.
And-- And well done.
All of you.
Very well done.
Excuse me.
Please.
Have they gone?
They have, at last. [chuckles]
Ada had to put Monkey in a fireman's lock before she could get him out.
translation.fr:
Ada a dû contraindre Monkey
à rentrer chez eux.

translation.en: How are you feeling? Hmm?
You any better?
[sighs] No, not much better, to be honest.
No... No...
No! [whimpers]
-[Arthur] Can anybody hear me?! -No!
Somebody send for a doctor!
[Walsh] Now, we might've lost...
but the town's still proud of you.
translation.fr: mais la ville est fière de vous.

translation.en: Here's the man of the hour, Fergus Suter!
